variables.name: mTopActivityComponent
variables.comment: Top activity in task when snapshot was taken

variables.name: mOrientation
variables.comment: Indicates whether task was in landscape or portrait

variables.name: mTaskSize
variables.comment: The size of the snapshot before scaling

variables.name: mIsLowResolution
variables.comment: mainly for loading snapshots quickly from disk when user is flinging fast

variables.name: mIsRealSnapshot
variables.comment: the task having a secure window or having previews disabled

variables.name: mColorSpace
variables.comment: Must be one of the named color spaces, otherwise, always use SRGB color space.

methods.name: public ComponentName getTopActivityComponent()
methods.comment: * @return The top activity component for the task at the point this snapshot was taken.

methods.name: public GraphicBuffer getSnapshot()
methods.comment: * @return The graphic buffer representing the screenshot.

methods.name: public ColorSpace getColorSpace()
methods.comment: * @return The color space of graphic buffer representing the screenshot.

methods.name: public int getOrientation()
methods.comment: * @return The screen orientation the screenshot was taken in.

methods.name: public int getRotation()
methods.comment: * @return The screen rotation the screenshot was taken in.

methods.name: public Point getTaskSize()
methods.comment: * @return The size of the task at the point this snapshot was taken.

methods.name: public Rect getContentInsets()
methods.comment:
* @return The system/content insets on the snapshot. These can be clipped off in order to
         *         remove any areas behind system bars in the snapshot.

methods.name: public boolean isLowResolution()
methods.comment: * @return Whether this snapshot is a down-sampled version of the full resolution.

methods.name: public boolean isRealSnapshot()
methods.comment:
* @return Whether or not the snapshot is a real snapshot or an app-theme generated snapshot
         * due to the task having a secure window or having previews disabled.

methods.name: public boolean isTranslucent()
methods.comment:
* @return Whether or not the snapshot is of a translucent app window (non-fullscreen or has
         * a non-opaque pixel format).

methods.name: public int getWindowingMode()
methods.comment: * @return The windowing mode of the task when this snapshot was taken.

methods.name: public int getSystemUiVisibility()
methods.comment:
* @return The system ui visibility flags for the top most visible fullscreen window at the
         *         time that the snapshot was taken.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
